channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for OH
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for OH

item.title: Report E-2024120005
item.description:
Report E-2024120005

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-04T12:24:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-27
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On November 27, 2024, three (3) 5-gallon pails of paint were crushed and released three (3) gallons of paint to the trailer. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to collect all waste in two (2) 55-gallon drums.

item.title: Report X-2024111003
item.description:
Report X-2024111003

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-28T06:19:59+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-12
  • City: CLEVELAND
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: Norfolk Southern
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: NS personnel reported a leak from UTLX205122 under movement. Upon inspection by Railroad response contractor, car found to have 2 less than tool tight manway bolts. Car also found to have worn, non-sealing lid gasket. The manway gasket was replaced and the manway bolts were secured tool tight.
